etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in William Kirby (1759–1850), entomologist and naturalist. From meso- + sternum

definitions: The sternum of the mesothorax of an insect or (especially formerly) an equivalent or associated part. Also (in Zoology): the middle plate of the sternum in brachyuran crabs.
The body of the sternum, situated between the manubrium and the xiphisternum.
